source_name: 伯大尼博物館 導賞團 (2025年8月)
source_address: 139 Pok Fu Lam Road, Pok Fu Lam, Hong Kong
source_introduction: The Bethanie Museum in Hong Kong is located at the Bethanie Convent in Pok Fu Lam, a designated heritage site under the Hong Kong Academy for Performing Arts. Over a century old, it blends French Gothic architectural style with local cultural elements. Visitors can reserve spots for periodically conducted guided tours to explore the convent's chapel, museum exhibitions, and underground wine cellar, learning about missionary history, the intersection of Chinese and French cultures, and the discovery and cultivation of Bauhinia Blakeana. Bookings via Cityline are required in advance as sessions are limited and frequently sold out. The activity suits those interested in history, architecture, art, and culture, offering insights into the performing arts academy's local development and heritage preservation efforts.
enrich_localName: 伯大尼博物館 導賞團 (2025年8月)
enrich_englishName: Bethanie Museum Guided Tour (August 2025)
enrich_textEmbedding: The Bethanie Museum Guided Tour takes you deep into the over-century-old Bethanie Convent, exploring French Gothic architecture, museum exhibitions, and underground cellars. Discover the history of missionaries, the fusion of Chinese and French cultures, and the Bauhinia Blakeana discovery story. The program is operated by the Hong Kong Academy for Performing Arts and requires advance reservations. It's ideal for history, architecture, and art enthusiasts to learn about this culturally significant venue.
enrich_description: In-depth experience in a 100+ year old French colonial heritage site explores history, architecture and culture.

source_name: M+戲院夏季節目：電影《搞鬼小築》特別放映
source_address: West Kowloon Cultural District, Hong Kong
source_introduction: The Happiness of the Katakuris is a 2001 film directed by Takashi Miike. As part of the 2025 summer program at M+ Cinema in West Kowloon Cultural District, it is being specially screened in the rare 35mm film format. The program also includes a retrospective of Keanu Reeves' classic works and an ASEAN film festival, providing a rich and diverse cinematic cultural experience and immersing audiences in a creative and unique audiovisual journey.

enrich_englishName: The Happiness of the Katakuris Special Screening at M+ Cinema, West Kowloon Cultural District
enrich_textEmbedding: The Happiness of the Katakuris, a 2001 film by Takashi Miike, is specially screened in 35mm film format at the M+ Cinema in West Kowloon Cultural District as part of the 2025 summer program featuring Keanu Reeves' classics and ASEAN film festival. It offers a unique cultural film experience combining rare film format viewing and diverse cinematic showcases.
enrich_description: Special 35mm film screening of The Happiness of the Katakuris at M+ Cinema, West Kowloon.

source_introduction: Wu Chunyan's Four Great Classical Literary Works Symphony Golden Classic Concert will be held at Shenzhen Nanshan Cultural Center JuCheng Theater Grand Theater. source_name: 前衛正：時光旅人
source_address: M+ Museum, West Kowloon Cultural District, 8 West Argyle Street, Tsim Sha Tsui, Kowloon, Hong Kong
source_introduction: 『Avant-Garde Right: Time Traveler』is one of the M+ Cinema 2025 Summer Programs, featuring four contemporary artists and directors—Monira Al Qadiri, Cao Fei, Masatoshi Asano, and Sudarshan Belliappa—who create a series of artistic visions for the future by skillfully combining sci-fi, fantasy and cultural elements. Through film, installations and multimedia works, the exhibition explores how time shapes visual expression and cultural narratives, inviting audiences to embark on a cinematic visual journey across time and space[1][5].
enrich_localName: 前衛正：時光旅人
enrich_englishName: Avant-Garde Right: Time Traveler
enrich_textEmbedding: 『Avant-Garde Right: Time Traveler』 presented at M+ Museum Hong Kong, showcases original works by four international artists who integrate sci-fi, fantasy and cultural elements to guide audiences through multiple temporal and spatial dimensions, experiencing emerging prospects for visual art and cultural storytelling. The exhibition features cross-media presentations of film, installations and performance, adding exceptional value to local cultural events[1][5].
enrich_description: Interdisciplinary art exhibition exploring the interwoven dimensions of sci-fi, fantasy and cultural storytelling in a futuristic journey.

source_name: 舞劇《人在花間住》深圳站 - 國家藝術基金專案舞劇
source_address: Grand Theatre, Polphoenix Theatre Complex, Cultural and Sports Center, Nanshan District, Shenzhen City
source_introduction: Dance drama "Living Among Flowers" Shenzhen Station centers on Alzheimer's patients, using Lingnan culture and Guangdong music as its backdrop. Through dance, it portrays deep maternal bonds and the warmth of everyday life. Supported by the National Arts Fund, the play is an innovative blend of realism and artistic aesthetics, highlighting Lingnan people's love for flowers and their appreciation of aesthetic living. The performance will be held at the Grand Theatre of Polphoenix Theatre Complex in Shenzhen's Nanshan Cultural and Sports Center from July 25 to 26, 2025, with tickets now in high demand.
enrich_localName: 舞劇《人在花間住》深圳站 - 國家藝術基金專案舞劇
enrich_englishName: Dance Drama "Living Among Flowers" Shenzhen Station - National Arts Fund Project
enrich_textEmbedding: Dance drama "Living Among Flowers" will be grandly staged at the Grand Theatre of Polphoenix Theatre Complex in Nanshan Cultural and Sports Center, Shenzhen from July 25 to 26, 2025. Focused on Alzheimer's patients and rooted in Lingnan culture, the production uses dance to depict maternal-child affection and genuine moments in daily life. It innovatively merges realistic narratives with artistic beauty, representing a significant work supported by the National Arts Fund that delivers a cultural experience filled with love and aesthetics.
enrich_description: Shenzhen Polphoenix Theatre presents a realistic dance drama about Alzheimer's patients, exploring the emotional connection between mother and child, and the cultural richness of Lingnan life.

source_name: 西九文化區x 綠葉劇團：《山海經》第一部曲──山川命．終章
source_address: Free Space Big Box, West Kowloon Cultural District, No. 1 West Kowloon Cultural District Center Road, Hong Kong, Kowloon
source_introduction: Classic of Mountains and Seas Part One: The Command of Mountains and Rivers Finale is a stage play jointly produced and presented by the West Kowloon Cultural District and Green Leaf Theatre. Combining physical theatre, opera, and papercraft artistry, this production reinterprets the mythological world of the ancient Chinese classic, guiding audiences to explore the creation of the universe and the legends of mystical creatures. Staged at the Free Space Big Box venue in the West Kowloon Cultural District, it is one of the key performances in the district's Creator Series, presenting a fusion of Eastern and Western artistic styles and demonstrating the narrative power of physical theatre, allowing audiences to witness the integration of original fantasy and cultural heritage.
enrich_localName: 西九文化區x 綠葉劇團：《山海經》第一部曲──山川命．終章
enrich_englishName: West Kowloon Cultural District x Green Leaf Theatre: Classic of Mountains and Seas Part One – The Command of Mountains and Rivers Finale
enrich_textEmbedding: A joint presentation by the West Kowloon Cultural District and Green Leaf Theatre brings Classic of Mountains and Seas Part One – The Command of Mountains and Rivers Finale, which merges physical theatre, opera elements, and papercraft artistry. This stage play reimagines the mythological world of this ancient Chinese text, focusing on the universe's creation and the legendary creatures of the Classic of Mountains and Seas, staged at the Free Space Big Box venue. It represents a significant step in blending Eastern and Western traditional arts with theatrical aesthetics, inviting audiences to experience the enigma and wonder of cosmic origins and mythical imagination as a landmark local theatre event.
enrich_description: An artistic milestone event in the local theatre scene combining modern stage drama with the exploration of the myths from the Classic of Mountains and Seas.

source_name: 哥伦比亚狂想——博特罗艺术大展
source_address: Southern Bank of Bai'etan, Bai'etan Branch of Guangdong Museum of Art, Yuexiu District, Guangzhou City, Guangdong Province, China
source_introduction: The 'Colombian Rhapsody - Botero Art Exhibition' opened on July 10, 2025, at the Bai'etan Branch of the Guangdong Museum of Art. It showcases over 80 representative works by Colombian national treasure artist Fernando Botero, including oil paintings, sculptures, and paper artworks. This marks the first comprehensive exhibition of Botero's art in the Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macao Greater Bay Area, highlighting his signature exaggerated aesthetic style and offering a rare in-depth cultural and artistic experience.
enrich_localName: 哥伦比亚狂想——博特罗艺术大展
enrich_englishName: Colombian Rhapsody - Botero Art Exhibition
enrich_textEmbedding: The Colombian Rhapsody - Botero Art Exhibition is held at Guangdong Museum of Art, presenting over 80 iconic works by Colombian master Fernando Botero including paintings, sculptures, and paper media. This is Botero's first major show in the Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macao Greater Bay Area, showcasing his characteristic exaggerated aesthetic style. It offers a unique cultural experience in Guangzhou's Yuexiu District.
enrich_description: Exhibition of over 80 iconic Botero works, showcasing Colombian exaggerated aesthetics in Guangzhou.

source_name: 楊麗萍作品《平潭映象》香港站
source_address: Hong Kong West Kowloon Cultural District, Xiqu Centre Grand Theatre, Hong Kong
source_introduction: 'Impression of Pingtan,' directed by renowned dancer Yang Liping, is a stage musical that uses the sea as its canvas and the island as its soul. It integrates China's traditional folk customs with maritime themes, presenting the human and natural landscapes of both sides of the strait through mythological stories. Focused on Eastern aesthetics, the production employs modern stage technology and traditional performing art expressions to deliver a feast for both sight and sound. The Hong Kong leg of the tour will take place at the Grand Theatre of the Xiqu Centre in the West Kowloon Cultural District, offering local audiences a fresh and unique cultural experience. The performance lasts approximately 120 minutes with no intermission.
enrich_localName: 楊麗萍作品《平潭映象》| 西九文化區戲曲中心大劇院
enrich_englishName: Yang Liping's 'Impression of Pingtan' | Xiqu Centre Grand Theatre, West Kowloon Cultural District
enrich_textEmbedding: Yang Liping’s 'Impression of Pingtan' is a grand theatre production that masterfully blends traditional Chinese folklore with marine themes, set against a mythic narrative. Renowned for its striking visual aesthetics and dynamic choreography, the show presents an immersive experience of Eastern culture. The Hong Kong stop will be held at the Xiqu Centre Grand Theatre in the West Kowloon Cultural District, making it a highlight for local arts and culture enthusiasts seeking a unique, visually stunning performance.
enrich_description: A visually captivating stage production blending Chinese folklore and marine themes by Yang Liping, performed at Xiqu Centre.

source_introduction: Summer Fling: Ballet Family Fun Day is held on August 1, 2025, at 2:30 PM and 4:30 PM in Room 1, 4th Floor, Hong Kong Academy for Performing Arts. The performance lasts approximately one hour without an intermission and features beloved excerpts from classic Hong Kong Ballet productions such as Sleeping Beauty and Romeo + Juliet, accompanied live by pianist Liu Zhicong of the Hong Kong Ballet. Following the performance, an interactive ballet workshop will be conducted where participants can learn ballet moves, view costumes up close, and create their own ballet-themed souvenirs. The event is suitable for all ages and offers a shared family ballet art experience.

With live piano accompaniment and an interactive ballet workshop, this event invites families and ballet lovers to discover the vibrant, charming world of ballet in an intimate setting.

source_name: 西九夜延場
source_address: Tea House Theatre at the Xiqu Centre in the West Kowloon Cultural District
source_introduction: The West Kowloon Cultural District launches a new Cabaret program series, 'West Kowloon Cabaret Nights,' starting in May 2025, with 2 to 3 selected weekday evenings staged each month at the Xiqu Centre Tea House Theatre. The program includes original cross-disciplinary performances that combine music, musical theatre, musical comedy, and theatrical elements, featuring both emerging and established artists. Each performance occurs in the Tea House Theatre’s unique space, breaking traditional performance frameworks through cross-boundary formats to deliver an interactive and immersive experience for audiences. It is ideal for those interested in cultural arts, live music, and cross-disciplinary entertainment. Tickets can be purchased through Cityline and art-mate, with half-price discounts available for full-time students, residents aged 60 or above, and other select groups [1][2][3].
enrich_localName: 西九夜延場
enrich_englishName: West Kowloon Cabaret Nights
enrich_textEmbedding: Cabaret Nights at West Kowloon Cultural District's Xiqu Centre Tea House Theatre offer a unique blend of live music, musical theatre, and comedy in an intimate and immersive setting. Each evening features original, boundary-crossing performances by both emerging and established artists. The program runs select nights from May to July 2025, delivering an engaging cultural experience that celebrates Hong Kong's multicultural artistic scene.
enrich_description: A cross-disciplinary cabaret performance blending music, drama, and live interactive elements, with emerging and established artists sharing the stage.

source_name: 滙豐160週年滙聚怪招《笨蕉大劇院》
source_address: Hong Kong Academy for Performing Arts Opera House, 1/F, 10 Salisbury Rd, Tsim Sha Tsui, Kowloon, Hong Kong
source_introduction: HSBC's 160th Anniversary Presents: Let Me Entertain You is a theatrical production running 50 consecutive performances from August 8 to October 4, 2025, at the Hong Kong Academy for Performing Arts Opera House. Starring Lin Haifeng, Geoffrey Cheung, Verosa, and Ke Weilam, directed by Tang Weijie and written by Li Weile, the performance features humorous storytelling and a strong cast. Tickets are priced between HKD 480 and 1280, with an additional HKD 80 priority booking fee. Shows are held nightly at 8 PM on Tuesdays to Saturdays, and on Sundays at 3 PM in the Tsim Sha Tsui district, offering audiences laughter and entertainment.
enrich_localName: 滙豐160週年滙聚怪招《笨蕉大劇院》
enrich_englishName: HSBC 160th Anniversary Presents: Let Me Entertain You Theatre Show
enrich_textEmbedding: HSBC's 160th Anniversary event features the theatrical comedy 'Let Me Entertain You' running from August to October 2025 at the Hong Kong Academy for Performing Arts Opera House. Starring Lin Haifeng, Geoffrey Cheung, Verosa, and Ke Weilam, directed by Tang Weijie and written by Li Weile, the 50-show series offers engaging comedic performances starting at HKD 480. Scheduled for Tuesdays to Saturdays at 8 PM and Sundays at 3 PM in the bustling Tsim Sha Tsui district.
enrich_description: A lively comedy theatre performance celebrating HSBC’s 160th anniversary in Hong Kong.

source_name: 俄羅斯瓦赫坦戈夫劇院話劇《葉甫蓋尼·奧涅金》深圳站
source_address: Opera Hall, Shenzhen Binhai Art Center, Baoxing Road, Xinhua Subdistrict, Bao'an District, Shenzhen, Guangdong Province, China
source_introduction: The Russian Vakhtangov Theatre's stage play 'Eugene Onegin' will be performed from September 11 to 12, 2025, at the Shenzhen Binhai Art Center Opera Hall. This production is adapted from the eponymous poetic novel by Russian literary giant Pushkin, depicting protagonist Onegin's disillusionment with urban elite life and emotional conflicts with young woman Tatiana after moving to the countryside. The performance integrates classical literary elements with visual and musical artistry, embodying the pinnacle of Russian stage drama and offering a culturally enriching experience for theater enthusiasts.
enrich_localName: 俄羅斯瓦赫坦戈夫劇院話劇《葉甫蓋尼·奧涅金》深圳站
enrich_englishName: Russian Vakhtangov Theatre Drama 'Eugene Onegin' Shenzhen
enrich_textEmbedding: Russian Vakhtangov Theatre brings its acclaimed drama 'Eugene Onegin' adapted from Pushkin's poetic novel to Shenzhen Binhai Art Center Opera House for performances on September 11-12, 2025. The play explores themes of societal disillusionment and romantic entanglements, blending literature, visual art, and music, showcasing Russian theatrical excellence in China's cultural scene.
enrich_description: Experience the Russian Vakhtangov Theatre's acclaimed drama 'Eugene Onegin' at the Shenzhen Binhai Art Center this September.

source_address: Nanshan Cultural and Sports Center Orange Theater's large theater in Nanshan District, Shenzhen City
source_introduction: The original English-language musical 'tick,tick...BOOM! 倒数时刻' will be performed from October 2 to 8, 2025, at the large theater of Orange Theater within Shenzhen Nanshan Cultural and Sports Center. The 95-minute show has no intermission and is suitable for children aged 2 and above. Shenzhen is the only stop in the Greater Bay Area for this English musical, with tickets priced from 180 to 780 RMB. It features high-quality live band accompaniment and showcases an inspiring musical journey about pursuing dreams.

source_name: 2025 翁倩玉 Judy Ongg Thank you for your smile 香港演唱會
source_address: Xiqu Centre Grand Theatre, West Kowloon Cultural District, Kowloon
source_introduction: Judy Ongg returns to Hong Kong with her "Thank you for your smile" concert, held at the West Kowloon Cultural District's Xiqu Centre Grand Theatre on July 12 & 13, 2025. This event features her timeless classic songs, showcasing her elegant and warm voice. Judy is a legendary singer known for "Prayer", "Love Will Be Given", and the theme song of "The Story of Arison". She is one of the few ethnic-Chinese singers to have performed on Japan's NHK Red and White Song Battle.

enrich_englishName: 2025 Judy Ongg Thank you for your smile Hong Kong Concert
enrich_textEmbedding: Enjoy Judy Ongg's concert at the Xiqu Centre in West Kowloon, featuring her classic songs. Known for hits like "Prayer" and the theme of "The Story of Arison", Judy brings her iconic voice to the stage.
enrich_description: Legendary Judy Ongg's live concert

source_introduction: M+ Cinema is hosting the 'Stair in the Dark' screening series in Summer 2025, focusing on Keanu Reeves' iconic sci-fi film The Matrix. Renowned for its cyberpunk aesthetic and philosophical inquiries into the relationship between reality and virtuality, the event will take place at M+ Theatre within M+ Museum's West Kowloon Cultural District. The free public screenings allow audiences to revisit this 1999 international sci-fi classic and its lasting cultural influence.

Celebrated for its cyberpunk style and exploration of reality versus virtuality, this free screening invites audiences to experience the iconic 1999 film in a culturally rich setting.

source_name: 聽見泥土與蒼穹-世界音樂季系列《聲之靈》烏仁娜2025音樂會
source_address: Guangming Cultural Arts Center, Guangming District, Shenzhen, China
source_introduction: The 'Hearing the Earth and Sky - World Music Season Series 'Spirit of Sound' Urna 2025 Concert' will be held at 8 PM on July 5, 2025 at the Guangming Cultural Arts Center in Shenzhen. Renowned Inner Mongolian singer and international artist Urna Tsaachad will collaborate with three distinguished European musicians to weave Inner Mongolian pastoral songs with global musical elements, presenting transcendent auditory experiences beyond linguistic and geographical boundaries. This concert marks a significant event in the 'Awakening the East' segment of the World Music Season, offering audiences profound spiritual and emotional resonance through sound. It has received critical acclaim from international media outlets such as The Guardian and Songlines, highlighting the spiritual essence of music and its connection to natural harmonies.
enrich_localName: 聽見泥土與蒼穹-世界音樂季系列《聲之靈》烏仁娜2025音樂會
enrich_englishName: Hearing the Earth and Sky - World Music Season Series 'Spirit of Sound' Urna 2025 Concert
enrich_textEmbedding: The 2025 World Music Season concert 'Hearing the Earth and Sky - Spirit of Sound' featuring Urna, a renowned Inner Mongolian singer and international artist, will take place July 5 at Shenzhen Guangming Cultural Arts Center. Urna and European musicians blend pastoral songs with global sounds, evoking cross-cultural harmony and spiritual resonance praised by The Guardian and Songlines magazine.
enrich_description: Experience Urna’s soulful blend of pastoral and world music at Shenzhen’s world music season concert.

source_name: 伯大尼博物館導賞團
source_address: 139 Pok Fu Lam Road, Hong Kong
source_introduction: The Bethanie Museum is a declared monument located at Pok Fu Lam and part of the Bethanie campus at the Hong Kong Academy for Performing Arts. The museum offers monthly limited-time guided tours, featuring landmarks such as the Bethanie Theatre, the Bethanie Chapel built with original French architectural design, and other structures. Admission requires advance online booking at $25 per person regardless of age. Tours are conducted in Cantonese, lasting approximately 30 minutes. The content includes highlights of key restoration projects within the buildings, but certain areas will be closed during weddings or events.
enrich_localName: 伯大尼博物館導賞團
enrich_englishName: Bethanie Museum Guided Tour
enrich_textEmbedding: Explore the historical Bethanie Museum in Hong Kong with a guided tour. This museum, located in Pok Fu Lam, offers a glimpse into Hong Kong's rich cultural past through its architectural landmarks such as the Bethanie Chapel and Bethanie Theatre. The tour, conducted in Cantonese, highlights the restoration efforts and historical significance of these buildings.
enrich_description: Guided tour of historical Bethanie Museum.

source_name: 央華戲劇&莫言劇作《鱷魚》-常州站2025常州中吳文化系列活動
source_address: 2 Jinling North Road, Changzhou Grand Theatre's Main Auditorium, Changzhou City, Jiangsu Province, China
source_introduction: In 2025, the play Crocodile by Cathay Theatre & Mo Yan will be performed at the Main Auditorium of Changzhou Grand Theatre, starring Zhao Wenxuan, Zhang Kaili, and Deng Cuiwen. Written by Nobel Prize in Literature laureate Mo Yan, this original work is divided into four acts and nine scenes, exploring the secrets of human nature through the story of the protagonist Dan Wuhan and his birthday gift—the "crocodile." The play profoundly examines the theme of "desire" and is supported as a major funded stage project under the 2025 China National Arts Fund, marking a significant cultural event in mainland China. The performance dates are June 28-29, 2025.
enrich_localName: 央華戲劇&莫言劇作《鱷魚》-常州站2025常州中吳文化系列活動
enrich_englishName: Cathay Theatre & Mo Yan’s Play Crocodile - Changzhou Station 2025
enrich_textEmbedding: 2025's Cathay Theatre & Mo Yan's Play 'Crocodile,' starring Zhao Wenxuan, Zhang Kaili, and Deng Cuiwen, will be performed at Changzhou Grand Theatre from June 28-29. This groundbreaking work by Nobel Prize-winning author Mo Yan features four acts and nine scenes that revolve around the protagonist Dan Wuhan and a speaking crocodile he receives as a birthday gift. The play will premiere at the China National Arts Fund's 2025 large-scale stage project, one of the mainland's key cultural events.
enrich_description: A classic play by Mo Yan, staged at the Changzhou Grand Theatre, exploring themes of human nature and desire.

source_name: 俄羅斯瓦赫坦戈夫劇院話劇《萬尼亞舅舅》
source_address: No.1 Baixing Road, Xin An Subdistrict, Bao'an District, Shenzhen, Shenzhen Bay Art Center, Opera Hall
source_introduction: The classic drama 'Uncle Vanya' by the Russian Vakhtangov Theatre will be performed from September 13 to 14, 2025, at the Opera Hall, Shenzhen Bay Art Center. Starring Russian national treasure actor Sergey Makovetskiy, the play has won the prestigious Golden Mask Award (Russia's highest theatre honor in 2011). This marks the historic first performance of the production in the Pearl River Delta region, showcasing authentic Russian classic theatre art that promises an unforgettable experience for drama enthusiasts. Tickets range from ¥280 (charity seats) to ¥980 with multiple pricing tiers.
enrich_localName: 俄羅斯瓦赫坦戈夫劇院話劇《萬尼亞舅舅》
enrich_englishName: Russian Vakhtangov Theatre Drama 'Uncle Vanya'
enrich_textEmbedding: The Russian Vakhtangov Theatre's classic drama 'Uncle Vanya' will stage its Pearl River Delta debut at the Shenzhen Bay Art Center Opera Hall from September 13-14, 2025. This production, starring Golden Mask Award-winning actor Sergey Makovetskiy, delivers an elite Russian classic theatre experience. With ticket prices starting at ¥280 and multiple tiers available, this is ideal for cultural engagement by theatre enthusiasts.
enrich_description: The Russian Vakhtangov Theatre's classic play 'Uncle Vanya' will stage its Shenzhen premiere at the Opera Hall of the Shenzhen Bay Art Center, a cultural milestone event.

source_name: Family Tour & Creative Activities: Art & Technology Theme
source_address: Hong Kong Palace Museum Learning Centre, Hong Kong Imperial Cultural Centre, West Kowloon Cultural District
source_introduction: 『Family Tour & Creative Activities: Art & Technology Theme』 is the first family program launched by the Hong Kong Palace Museum, combining art and technology, exhibition guided tours, and creative activities. The event includes the special exhibition 『Wen: The Way of the Palace Museum's Immersive Digital Experience Exhibition』 along with interactive tours and hands-on crafting. A 50% time-limited discount on family membership is available for participants. The event will be held on July 23, 2025, offering morning and afternoon sessions. All activities will be conducted in Cantonese.
enrich_localName: Family Tour & Creative Activities: Art & Technology Theme
enrich_englishName: Family Tour & Creative Activities: Art & Technology Theme
enrich_textEmbedding: Family Tour & Creative Activities (Art & Technology Theme) is a Chinese traditional culture program hosted by the Hong Kong Palace Museum in the West Kowloon Cultural District, combining immersive digital exhibitions, interactive guided tours, and creative craft experiences. A limited-time family membership discount applies. Scheduled for July 23, 2025, with morning and afternoon time slots, it provides an educational and entertaining fusion of art and technology for family participation.
enrich_description: Family Tour integrates art and technology with creative activities for an educational and entertaining experience at the Hong Kong Palace Museum.

source_address: Nanshan Cultural Center Jucheng Theater Grand Theater, Nanshan Avenue, Nanshan District, Shenzhen City, Guangdong Province, China
source_introduction: The dance drama presents 'Burning: Moving Forward in Dance' by the Guangdong Modern Dance Troupe. The performance will take place at the Jucheng Theater Grand Theater in Shenzhen's Nanshan Cultural Center on July 18, 2025 at 20:00. The dance performance combines athletics such as racewalking, marathon, and relay running with urban parkour and street dance to create a unique sports theater language. The three-act production covers themes: Women Today, Flames and Youth, Shoulder to Shoulder A, showcasing diverse body elements and contemporary dance arts, offering the audience a vibrant and emotional visual experience.

This contemporary dance performance combines athletics such as racewalking, marathon, and relay racing with urban parkour and street dance to create a unique 'sports theater' language. The three-act drama portrays themes including today's women, flames and youth, and unity, offering a dynamic blend of movement and emotion in dance art.
enrich_description: A dynamic contemporary dance performance blending sport and art at Shenzhen's Nanshan Cultural Center.

source_name: M+戲院夏季節目：台階夜幕：奇洛李維斯「爛片」致敬展
source_address: West Kowloon Cultural District, Hong Kong
source_introduction: M+ Cinema at West Kowloon Cultural District will hold its summer program from July to September, featuring the 'Step by Night' series, which pays tribute to Hollywood actor Keanu Reeves. The program highlights his early representative works including 1989's 'Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure,' 1991's 'Point Break,' and classic 1999 film 'The Matrix.' The event aims to revisit the unique charm of this international movie star and his diverse presence across mainstream and alternative cultures. Additionally, the program will collaborate with the ASEAN Film Festival to screen free works by emerging Southeast Asian directors and host the 'Future Visions: Time Traveller' event, offering screenings, immersive virtual reality experiences, and dialogues with contemporary artists to showcase the richness of modern visual culture and future imagination.
enrich_localName: 台階夜幕：奇洛李維斯「爛片」致敬展
enrich_englishName: Step by Night: Tribute to Keanu Reeves’ Cult Films
enrich_textEmbedding: M+ Cinema’s Summer Programme at West Kowloon Cultural District presents 'Step by Night', a tribute to Keanu Reeves focusing on his cult films including 1989’s 'Bill & Ted’s Excellent Adventure', and classics such as 'Point Break' and 'The Matrix'. The event explores Reeves’ unique influence across different genres and cultures, alongside screenings of Southeast Asian contemporary films via the ASEAN Film Festival and 'Future Visions: Time Traveller', an immersive VR and art experience with dialogues led by contemporary artists, all aiming to showcase diverse visual culture, creativity, and future imaginations.
enrich_description: Pay tribute to international movie star Keanu Reeves and explore contemporary visual culture and future imaginations.

source_name: M+戲院2025年夏季節目－奇洛李維斯經典作品重溫及東盟電影節
source_address: West Kowloon Cultural District, 38 Austin Rd West, Tsim Sha Tsui, Kowloon, Hong Kong
source_introduction: From July to September 2025, M+ Cinema in Hong Kong's West Kowloon Cultural District presents its summer program themed 'Staircase to the Moon,' celebrating Hollywood icon Keanu Reeves through screenings of his three classic films: The Matrix (1999), Point Break (1991), and Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure (1989). The program coincides with the ASEAN Film Festival, showcasing creative works by Southeast Asian emerging directors and featuring interactive VR experiences alongside artist talks exploring alternative realities and futuristic themes.

enrich_textEmbedding: The M+ Cinema at West Kowloon Cultural District hosts its 2025 summer program from July to September, spotlighting Hollywood icon Keanu Reeves with screenings of his classic films including Point Break (1991) and The Matrix (1999). The event also features the ASEAN Film Festival showcasing emerging Southeast Asian filmmakers, plus interactive VR experiences and artist talks about alternative realities and future themes.

source_name: 藝術公園──綠行樹旅

source_introduction: An EcoDrive & Tree Dive guided tour that combines sustainable transport and the natural environment, where participants ride electric vehicles to explore the West Kowloon Cultural District Art Park, walk the tree trail, and learn the crucial ecological roles and environmental benefits of trees. The activity promotes ecological conservation and green commuting by offering an educational yet enjoyable outdoor experience.

enrich_englishName: Art Park – EcoDrive & Tree Dive

enrich_description: Explore the West Kowloon Art Park via electric vehicle tour, stroll the tree trail, identify trees' ecological roles and sustainable transportation practices.

source_name: Hong Kong Football Festival 2025 Arsenal vs Tottenham Hotspur | Kai Tak Sports Park
source_address: 38 Centric Avenue, Kai Tak Main Stadium, Kai Tak Sports Park, Kowloon
source_introduction: The 2025 Hong Kong Football Festival will bring together four global football clubs—Liverpool, AC Milan, Arsenal, and Tottenham—at the Kai Tak Main Stadium in Hong Kong. The Arsenal vs Tottenham (North London Derby) match will be held for the first time outside the UK, attracting fans across Hong Kong and the Asia-Pacific region. The game starts at 7:30 PM on July 31, 2025, with multiple ticket price tiers available on Trip.com and ticket platforms. Registered fans can also enjoy exclusive experiences such as team open training sessions and fan interactions with players. Other related events include Tottenham’s (July 29) and Arsenal’s (July 30) open training sessions, also held at Kai Tak Sports Park.
enrich_localName: Arsenal vs Tottenham Hotspur – Kinlok Cup | Kai Tak Sports Park
enrich_englishName: Arsenal vs Tottenham Hotspur – Kinlok Cup | Kai Tak Sports Park
enrich_textEmbedding: The Arsenal vs Tottenham Hotspur (North London Derby) match, presented as part of the Hong Kong Football Festival 2025, will be the first time this historic English Premier League rivalry is played outside the UK. Taking place at the new Kai Tak Sports Park on July 31, 2025, this high-profile event offers fans the rare chance to witness world-class football in Hong Kong, with additional experiences including pre-match open training sessions with the teams. Ticket prices range from HK$1,299, with premium hospitality options available for an enhanced matchday experience.
enrich_description: Witness Arsenal vs Spurs in the first North London Derby outside the UK at Kai Tak Sports Park.

source_introduction: The English original musical 'The Phantom of the Opera' will run at Shenzhen Binhai Art Centre's Song and Dance Hall from October 14 to 19, 2025. This timeless masterpiece has been performed in over 58 countries and 205 cities worldwide, attracting more than 160 million viewers and winning over 70 theater awards including the Olivier and Tony Awards. The performance lasts approximately 155 minutes with an intermission, features Chinese subtitles during the English show, is suitable for audiences over 1.2 meters in height, and offers multiple ticket price tiers with some charitable tickets.

This globally renowned musical theater masterpiece returns with powerful performances to deliver an unforgettable audiovisual spectacle. The performance features Chinese subtitles and lasts approximately 155 minutes while showcasing the highest level of stage artistry, highly popular among musical theater enthusiasts.
enrich_description: The classic English original musical 'The Phantom of the Opera' is thrillingly performed at Shenzhen Binhai Art Centre in 2025.

source_name: 伯大尼博物館免費導賞團 Bethanie Museum Guided Tour
source_address: 139 Pok Fu Lam Road, Hong Kong
source_introduction: The Bethanie Museum is located at 139 Pok Fu Lam Road in Hong Kong, a nearly 150-year-old government-declared historic site and part of the Hong Kong Academy for Performing Arts' Bethanie Campus. It offers complimentary guided tours in Cantonese, lasting approximately 30 minutes. Key points of interest include the octagonal Bethanie Theatre dating back to the late 19th century, a chapel with original stained glass windows and a restored altar, and the auditorium with a glass-replicated golden roof. Tickets must be reserved online through Klook, priced at $25, which grants access to the free guided tour. Certain areas may be temporarily closed for events such as weddings.
enrich_localName: 伯大尼博物館免費導賞團
enrich_englishName: Bethanie Museum Free Guided Tour
enrich_textEmbedding: Experience the historical Bethanie Museum in Pok Fu Lam, a nearly 150-year-old Hong Kong declared monument offering a 30-minute free Cantonese guided tour. Highlights include the 19th-century octagonal Bethanie Theatre, the small chapel with stained glass and altar restoration, and the Paul Y. K. Auditorium featuring a glass curtain reproducing the original golden roof. Museum entry requires ticket purchase via online reservation, priced at HK$25, which includes free tour access. The site is part of the Hong Kong Academy for Performing Arts campus and occasionally restricts areas due to private events.
enrich_description: Explore historical Bethanie Museum with a free guided tour highlighting restored heritage buildings.

source_name: 聲韻情繫戲曲十載情 折子戲專場 | 2025 西九文化區戲曲中心大劇院演唱會
source_address: Grand Theatre, Xiqu Centre, West Kowloon Cultural District, Kowloon, Hong Kong
source_introduction: Ten Years Love to Canto Opera - Selected Scenes Performance is a special exhibition celebrating the 10th anniversary of Xiqu Centre. It will take place on July 27, 2025 at Grand Theatre, West Kowloon Cultural District Xiqu Centre. The performance combines vocal, instrument, and storytelling techniques from Canto opera through various segments, showcasing the art form's rich heritage and emotional depth. This event offers a unique opportunity for local audiences to immerse themselves in traditional Chinese opera culture. Tickets will be publicly available since June 10, 2025 at 10 am through Cityline and Xiqu Centre Ticketing Offices. With competitive pricing in the market, this is a great cultural event for families and opera enthusiasts. A service fee applies for physical ticket purchases: Online booking has an additional HK$12 handling fee, and telephone booking has an additional HK$15 handling fee.
enrich_localName: 聲韻情繫戲曲十載情 折子戲專場
enrich_englishName: Ten Years Love to Canto Opera - Selected Scenes Performance
enrich_textEmbedding: Ten Years Love to Canto Opera is a special selected scenes concert celebrating the 10th anniversary of the Xiqu Centre. Held at the West Kowloon Cultural District Xiqu Centre Grand Theatre on July 27, 2025, the event features renowned Cantonese opera artists performing classic excerpts to showcase the rich vocal and emotional heritage of Cantonese opera, offering audiences an authentic traditional opera experience in Hong Kong.
enrich_description: Experience classic Cantonese opera excerpts celebrating 10 years of Xiqu Centre at West Kowloon.

source_name: 英國經典舞台劇《Skylight 天色 2025》
source_address: 1 Gloucester Road, Wan Chai, Hong Kong
source_introduction: The classic play 'Skylight' by British playwright David Hare, which won the Laurence Olivier Award for 'Best New Play' and 'Best Shared Production,' returns to Hong Kong in 2025. The Hong Kong version, 'Skylight 2025,' is directed by local director Simon Hui Zhuo Tsui, with the script translated and performed by Fiona Tam. Accompanied by veterans Edward Cheung and Lee Shun Yu, the production reimagines a complex tale of conflict and passion. Praised universally since its 2023 premiere and selling out every performance, it will reappear at the Hong Kong Academy for Performing Arts on July 2025, with tickets now available at Cityline.
enrich_englishName: Skylight 2025
enrich_textEmbedding: The UK classic play 'Skylight 2025,' directed by Simon Hui Zhuo Tsui featuring Fiona Tam, showcases intricate emotional tensions. Since its 2023 debut, the critically acclaimed production will return to Hong Kong in July 2025, attracting theatre enthusiasts to seize this rare opportunity at the Hong Kong Academy for Performing Arts.
enrich_description: A complex emotional tale in the critically acclaimed classic British play 'Skylight 2025,' presented by the Hong Kong Academy for Performing Arts.

source_name: Tea House Theatre 'Cantonese Opera, Music and Tea Rhythm'
source_address: Tea House Theatre, Chinese Opera Centre at West Kowloon Cultural District, Kowloon, Hong Kong
source_introduction: 'Cantonese Opera, Music and Tea Rhythm' is a 90-minute opera introduction production directed and curated by Cantonese opera legend Lo Ka Ying. It features Guangdong brand tunes, Cantonese opera excerpts, Cantonese singing, and Cantonese music performances, enhanced by engaging introductions to immerse audiences in the traditional essence of Cantonese opera. Held in the Tea House Theatre at West Kowloon's Chinese Opera Centre, the program combines a traditional Chinese teahouse layout with served fragrant tea and dim sum (including vegetarian options). The new season includes classics like 'Lady Macbeth of the Miao People' and 'The Orphan of Zhao', as well as a new modernized opera segment 'Feng Huo Jie Qi Yuan' with female hero Fanyuli Hua. Shows run in multiple afternoon sessions on weekends and evenings on Fridays, suitable for families and culture enthusiasts alike.
enrich_localName: 茶館劇場「粵・樂・茶韻」
enrich_englishName: Tea House Theatre 'Cantonese Opera, Music and Tea Rhythm'
enrich_textEmbedding: The Tea House Theatre's 'Cantonese Opera, Music and Tea Rhythm' in West Kowloon provides a 90-minute immersive Cantonese opera experience, featuring classical excerpts, live performances of famous Cantonese music, and traditional Chinese tea with dim sum. Master-minded by opera legend Lo Ka Ying, the immersive production combines highlighted segments from classic operas with musical interpretations in a space designed to reference traditional teahouses. It runs from July 2025 to March 2026, offering an authentic sensory and cultural encounter of Hong Kong's heritage.
enrich_description: Authentic Cantonese opera with tea and snacks in a traditional teahouse setting at West Kowloon.

source_name: Silicon Valley BizWorld Entrepreneurship Summer Camp 香港澳洲國際學校
source_address: Hong Kong Australian International School, Hong Kong
source_introduction: The Silicon Valley BizWorld Entrepreneurship Summer Camp at Hong Kong Australian International School offers children aged 8 to 14 a unique, experiential summer camp focused on entrepreneurship. Participants form teams to plan, fundraise, and run their own startup companies through hands-on activities such as product design, budgeting, marketing, and sales. The program develops leadership, communication, teamwork, critical thinking, and financial literacy, culminating in a fun sales bazaar to showcase their businesses.

enrich_textEmbedding: The Silicon Valley BizWorld Entrepreneurship Summer Camp at Hong Kong Australian International School provides children aged 8-14 an immersive entrepreneurship experience. Teams of students develop and operate their own startup companies through comprehensive hands-on activities that build leadership, teamwork, communication, financial literacy, and critical thinking skills. The camp culminates with a sales bazaar and fosters confidence and a practical understanding of business management in an engaging environment.
